Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph

Interface Connected<T extends Connected<?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - this class subclass, i.e. Edge is declared as Connected<Edge> and Node as Connected<Node>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Edge, Node, TreeNode
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ALDataEdge, ALDataNode, ALEdge, ALNode, ALReadOnlyDataEdge, ALReadOnlyDataNode, SimpleDataTreeNode, SimpleReadOnlyDataTreeNode, SimpleTreeNode, TreeGraphDataNode, TreeGraphNode, TreeGraphReadOnlyDataNode
    public interface Connected<T extends Connected<?>>
    Interface for connected elements that are used to construct a graph, i.e. ancestor to the Node and Edge interfaces.
    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 9 mai 2019

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void connectLike​(T element)
      Connects this connected element (node or edge) exactly like the argument, i.e by losing its former connections before copying those of the argument.
      void disconnect()
      Safely disconnects this connected element (node or edge) from the graph (by taking care of references to it by neighbouring connected elements)
      void disconnectFrom​(Direction direction, Node node)
      Disconnects this connected element (node or edge) from the node passed as argument.
      void disconnectFrom​(Node node)
      Disconnects this connected element (node or edge) from the node passed as argument.
      void replace​(T element)
      Replaces another connected element of the same type (node or edge) by this instance.
      default java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal()
      Fetches all the connected elements (nodes or edges) connected to this instance, and returns the result as a Graph.
      java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(int distance)
      As traversal(), but stopping after distance recursion steps.
      java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(int distance, Direction direction)
      As traversal(), but following only one direction from the starting connected element (node or edge) and stopping after distance recursion steps.
      default java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(Direction direction)
      As traversal(), but following only one direction from the starting connected element (edge or node).

    • Method Detail

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Safely disconnects this connected element (node or edge) from the graph (by taking care of references to it by neighbouring connected elements)

      • disconnectFrom

        void disconnectFrom​(Node node)
        Disconnects this connected element (node or edge) from the node passed as argument.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to disconnect from

      • disconnectFrom

        void disconnectFrom​(Direction direction,
                    Node node)
        Disconnects this connected element (node or edge) from the node passed as argument.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction in which to disconnect (if IN, node is the start node)
        node - the node to disconnect from

      • connectLike

        void connectLike​(T element)
        Connects this connected element (node or edge) exactly like the argument, i.e by losing its former connections before copying those of the argument.
        Parameters:
        element - the connected element (node or edge) to copy connections from

      • replace

        void replace​(T element)
        Replaces another connected element of the same type (node or edge) by this instance. This instance adds the argument connections to its former connections, and the argument is disconnected from the graph.
        Parameters:
        element - the connected element (node or edge) to replace

      • traversal

        java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(int distance)
        As traversal(), but stopping after distance recursion steps. For example, node.traversal(1) will return only node, while node.traversal(2) will return all the nodes connected with only 1 edge to this one.
        Parameters:
        distance - the number of recursion steps to search
        Returns:
        the connected component (=sub-graph) containing this instance

      • traversal

        java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(int distance,
                                               Direction direction)
        As traversal(), but following only one direction from the starting connected element (node or edge) and stopping after distance recursion steps.
        Parameters:
        distance - the number of recursion steps to search
        direction - the direction in which to search
        Returns:
        the connected component (=sub-graph) containing this instance

      • traversal

        default java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal()

        Fetches all the connected elements (nodes or edges) connected to this instance, and returns the result as a Graph. For connected components, this will return the whole connected component. For graphs with unconnected parts, this will not return the whole graph, but the connected component to which this instance belongs.

        NOTE: depending on the graph size, this may be slow.

        Returns:
        the connected component (=sub-graph) containing this instance

      • traversal

        default java.util.Collection<? extends Node> traversal​(Direction direction)
        As traversal(), but following only one direction from the starting connected element (edge or node).
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction in which to search
        Returns:
        the connected component (=sub-graph) containing this instance
